txt.en:
'Crannog is waiting for my judgement of your worth? This is no small burden, and I will not make my decision lightly! But I thank him for your attention, for there is something you can do to earn my judgement.

'My brother Tasgall is a hunter of no small worth, but he has not returned from his latest foray into the wild. I ask you to travel north into Fasach-larran and search for my brother.

'Give him your aid, and if he deems you worthy, so too will I, and Crannog will hear of your deeds.'

'My sister sent you? She worries always, despite my assurances. But you are not one of the Trév Gállorg and do not have a Fém!\n\n'I will help you test your strength, and perhaps my task here will go more quickly for it. The hill-beasts of Nád Nathair have proven a savage menace.'
'My brother Tasgall left Aughaire travelling north, and he has not returned for some days. Go to his aid, if he has need of it, and I will give Crannog my judgement of your worth!'
'You must help me end the menace of the hill-beasts.'
Rona is very worried about her brother Tasgall, who travelled into Fasach-larran and has not yet returned.
'Help Tasgall with his errand, and you will have my well-wishes.'
'Return to me when you have lightened all of Tasgall's burdens.'
Tasgall left Aughaire travelling north and is likely somewhere in Fasach-larran.\n\nRona has agreed to give Crannog a favourable report of your doings if you render your aid to her brother Tasgall.
